citation.article-title: Perlucidibaca piscinae gen. nov., sp. nov., a freshwater bacterium belonging to the family Moraxellaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Perlucidibaca piscinae sp. nov.
Perlucidibaca piscinae (pis.ci′nae. L. gen. n. piscinae of a fish-pond).
The description is the same as that for the genus, with the following additional properties.
Cells in the exponential phase are short rods, 0.7–1.2 μm long and 0.5–0.7 μm wide.
Colonies on R2A agar are circular, convex, smooth, butyrous and transparent with an entire margin.
Colony size is 0.5–1.0 mm after incubation on R2A at 30 °C for 5 days.
Grows at 8–37 °C (optimally at 30 °C), but not at 4 and 42 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 6–10 and with 0–1 % NaCl; optimum at pH 7.0 and without NaCl.
